text:
Cat is the first Cat Unit available for the player when starting the game. True Form greatly increases its attack power and health.
| Cat Unit # 000 |
|---|
| Normal Cat |
Evolution
Evolves into Macho Cat at level 10.
Evolves into Mohawk Cat at level 20+10 using Cat Tickets.
Performance
Pros
- Very short cooldown
- Very low cost
- Part of multiple combos
Cons
- Single Attack
- Low DPS
| Class |
|---|
| Meatshield |
Strategy/Usage
A basic unit with low health and attack power, with no special abilities; you will need more than this cat alone in later stages. Fortunately, it is cheap and has a short recharge time so it can be spammed.
Alongside Tank Cat and others of its likeness, Cat can be used to slow down or even immobilize enemies completely by acting as a meatshield. Using this compensation with hard-hitters behind the numbers creates a wall that approaches the enemy base slowly, but surely. On his own, however, it gets overshadowed by Tank Cat as the latter is designed to better resist attacks and hold ground. There are still situations where Cat is the better choice, being against enemies and situations where Tank's extra health does not matter, due to how strong the enemy attacks are.
Another good aspect of this unit is that it appears in many Cat Combos, most notably Cat Army, suited for the very beginning of the game, and Mo' Hawks for mid-game. Hence, you should not underestimate its potential.
True Form
Mohawk Cat gains double its original health and attack power in True Form, which allows it to solo stages on most beginner stages and chapters. However, the boost in stats is not enough to give Mohawk Cat any other role besides cannon fodder. This form, however, still allows it to sometimes survive an attack from a weak peon that his previous forms would not handle as well; but in Uncanny Legends and late-game Stories of Legend, this makes little or no difference. Therefore, it is important to note that without an overabundance of "+" levels, Mohawk Cat will not be any more useful than any other meatshield of the same cost.

- *First stats are 1st form's initial; other stats include 300% Empire of Cats Treasures; recharge time may vary.
- *Time between attacks is the time from the attack's execution to the start of the next attack (includes backswing).
- *For units with multi-hit attacks, foreswing is the part of the animation leading up to the first hit.
- *Fruit Treasures not included.
- *See this section to calculate Cat's stats.
- HP = Health ; AP = Attack Power ; DPS = Damage Per Second ; 2 Movement Speed = 1 Range/f
- f = frame ; 30f = 1 second ; Attack Animation = Idle + Foreswing + Backswing (f)
- Catseye, User Rank and game progress are essential to achieving max level, see here for details.
- See here to understand Treasure effects.
Appearance
- Normal Form: A basic, round cat. It walks forward with its mouth open. Attacks by biting enemies.
- Evolved Form: Looks the same, but now has muscular arms extending out of the side of its body.
- True Form: Now has a stylish black mohawk growing out of its head.
Existence Elsewhere
Sangokushi Rumble
Cat appears in Sangokushi Rumble as a unit and as a 3★ infantry general card that evolves into Macho Cat and can be obtained by rolling the collab gacha.
Merc Storia
Cat appears in Merc Storia as a 1★ monster introduced in the first collaboration between the two games. It appears in collaboration stages during the event duration and can be obtained through them.

A soldier in the Cat Army. It has short legs on a round body not that strong, but due to their versatility and large number, they are troublesome as enemies. Admires muscular bodies. |

A health-conscious cat with an eye for fresh yasai. She goes to the supermarket in the next town to buy her favorite food carrots. She is also environmentally conscious with her handmade eco-bag. Two-meal type. |

A cat that loves tomatoes and is loved by tomatoes. He continues to support the growth of tomatoes with his well-trained body and feels the greatest joy in such days. Red Yasai, three-meal type. |

Gallery
Trivia
- Its sprites are used as placeholders for unimplemented or regional exclusive units.
- Cat has the most variants out of all the Cats in the game.
- Prior to Version 4.7, Macho Cat was a part of three other Cat Combos: Cat Army MkII, Maxed Out and Biceps.
- In The Battle Cats POP!, this unit is called "Basic Cat".
